data.name: PostgreSQL
data.description: View of key metrics relating to the storage and performance of PostgreSQL.

markdown.markdownText:
**PostgreSQL** 

![image.png](data:image/png;base64,)

PostgreSQL is a powerful, open source object-relational database system that uses and extends the SQL language combined with many features that safely store and scale the most complicated data workloads. Using PostgreSQL you can define your own data types, build out custom functions, even write code from different programming languages without recompiling your database.

Details of integrations to bring in PostgreSQL [here](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector-contrib/tree/main/receiver/postgresqlreceiver)

**UseCases Covered:**

* Connection Utilization
* Replication Monitoring
* Table & Index Storage Analysis
* Database Inventory
* Background Writer Performance
* Table Row Statistics
* Transaction Volume Analysis
* Database Operation Throughput

More about performance monitoring of PostgreSQL [here](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector-contrib/blob/main/receiver/postgresqlreceiver/documentation.md)
